title.native: ソードアート・オンライン II

description:
One year after the SAO incident, Kirito is approached by Seijiro Kikuoka from Japan's Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications Department "VR Division" with a rather peculiar request. That was an investigation on the "Death Gun" incident that occurred in the gun and steel filled VRMMO called Gun Gale Online (GGO). "Players who are shot by a mysterious avatar with a jet black gun lose their lives even in the real world..." Failing to turn down Kikuoka's bizarre request, Kirito logs in to GGO even though he is not completely convinced that the virtual world could physically affect the real world.

Kirito wanders in an unfamiliar world in order to gain any clues about the "Death Gun." Then, a female sniper named Sinon who owns a gigantic "Hecate II" rifle extends Kirito a helping hand. With Sinon's help, Kirito decides to enter the "Bullet of Bullets," a large tournament to choose the most powerful gunner within the realm of GGO, in hopes to become the target of the "Death Gun" and make direct contact with the mysterious avatar.

(Source: Crunchyroll)
synonyms: ซอร์ดอาร์ตออนไลน์ ภาค 2

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Death Game
tags.description: Features characters participating in a game, where failure results in death.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Unrequited Love
tags.description: One or more characters are experiencing an unrequited love that may or may not be reciprocated.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

name.native: アンドリュー・ギルバート・ミルズ

alternative: Berserker Healer (バーサクヒーラー)
Johnny Black (ジョニー・ブラック)

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/t_bamboo)

He grew up in Mexico because of his parents' work. In elementary school he read Ishinomori Shoutarou's Cyborg 009. Later he experienced the Yamato and Gundam boom, prompting him to be interested in animation. He started working as background artist, later becoming freelance. During that time Takeda got acquainted with Tokuhiro Hiragi and Tatsuya Kushida, whom he then helped establishing the art studio Bihou in 1993.

In 2005 he established the independent art studio Bamboo, which became a company in 2007.

(Source: AniDB)

__Current Residence:__ Nerima, Tokyo, Japan
__Doujin Circle:__ WordGear

Kawahara Reki graduated from the Aoyama Gakuin University.

[Official Website](http://wordgear.sblo.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kunori)
Representative director of [Aniplex](https://anilist.co/studio/17/). Board Director at [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/johnsama) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/75255)

Noted for his work in the [Sword Art Online](https://anilist.co/anime/11757/) franchise.

Married to fellow animator [Haruko Iizuka](https://anilist.co/staff/105678/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/johnsama) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/75255)

Noted for his work in the [Sword Art Online](https://anilist.co/anime/11757/) franchise.

Married to fellow animator [Haruko Iizuka](https://anilist.co/staff/105678/).

[Official website](http://bunplusbun.sakura.ne.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/bunbun922) | [Blog (abec)](http://abec.blog93.fc2.com/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/bunbun_plus) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/8142) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/c/BUNBUN922)

His older sister is [Yukiko Horiguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/102497/Yukiko-Horiguchi).

Major illustration works: 
- Kare Kanojo and Summon Magic (カレとカノジョと召喚魔法)
- Mary Rose (薔薇のマリア) - We AI (僕らA.I) 
- Shinkyoku Soukai Polyphonica Black Series (神曲奏界ポリフォニカ ブラック・シリーズ) 
- Girl with Radio Jamming (ラジオガール・ウィズ・ジャミング) 
- Zoahanta (ゾアハンター) (with Junichi Osako, author of Polyphonica Black) 
- Asuka 
- Garouden Mahjon - (アスカ -麻雀餓狼伝-) 
- All Death War (全死大戦)  

Other works: 
- Illustrations BUNBUN (illustration collection) 
- Rondo of Swords (DS game - character designs) 
- Shinkyoku Soukai Polyphonia THE BLACK (PC Game / Kinetic Novel - character designs).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Fion0806) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100001583365922) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0BLHMPWOZ2aTI0ZCCbtZem) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/yuki-kajiura/251013990) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/4663498)

Yuki Kajiura was born in Japan but raised in West Germany for most of her childhood. Her father was a big fan of classical and opera music and always desired for Yuki to play the piano for him. Yuki eventually gained a love for music and a love for the piano. Yuki started out as an SE programmer, but changed to music in 1992. She made her grand debut with a female trio called "[See-Saw](https://anilist.co/staff/104342)."  In the years to come the group released six singles and two albums. 

Yuki then went on to work on her solo career composing for artists and some TV, films, and games, such as _Blood: The Last Vampire_ in 2001, and _Xenosaga II_ and _III_. In 2001, Yuki's claim to fame came with the release of the anime [_NOIR_](https://anilist.co/anime/272). The soundtrack sold 50,000 copies. In 2002, she was brought on to project .hack to write the score to [_.hack//SIGN_](https://anilist.co/anime/48), along with vocalist [Chiaki Ishikawa](https://anilist.co/staff/101059) and New York singer [Emily Bindiger](https://anilist.co/staff/103845). Shortly after Yuki comprised an album of original and complied songs known as Fiction, working again with Emily Bindiger as well as _Xenosaga_ vocalist Deb Lyons.  

Yuki's other well-known works were for [_Mobile Suite Gundam Seed_](https://anilist.co/anime/93), which hit 5th on the Oricon Charts its first week, and selling over 200,000 copies. Yuki has also become known for her work on CLAMP's [_Tsubasa Chronicle_](https://anilist.co/anime/177) series, [movie](https://anilist.co/anime/807), and [OVAs](https://anilist.co/anime/2685). In 2003, she formed the project [FictionJunction](https://anilist.co/staff/103691) in which pairs Yuki's songwriting and composition with different performing vocalists, first as separate solo works and later into a singular group. In 2007, Yuki formed the band [Kalafina](https://anilist.co/staff/101975), with two partners from FictionJunction, Wakana Ootaki and [Keiko Kubota](https://anilist.co/staff/104664), to perform for the anime [_Kara no Kyoukai_](https://anilist.co/anime/2593), further working on several others. Kalafina disbanded in 2018, with their final lineup including Wakana, Keiko, and [Hikaru](https://anilist.co/staff/168857).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/331643934) | [Website](http://mazurka.moo.jp/)

While studying for a university degree in art, she was discovered by web artists [Shingo Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/114914/) and [Kenichi Kutsuna](https://anilist.co/staff/116007/), who recruited her to work on [Birdy Decode](https://anilist.co/anime/3974/). She did not join any particular studio, but started her career as a freelancer.

Website | Blog | Portfolio | Anison __Kouta Kobayashi__, commonly known as Yashikin, is a Japanese lyricist, composer and orechestrator. He was born in Toshima-ku, Tokyo, Japan, and brought up in Ikebukuro. He is affiliated with F.M.F.
